alert.note: Alert for Clay (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 11 at 10:52AM CDT until further notice by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Minnesota...North Dakota... Red River of the North at Fargo affecting Clay and Cass Counties. .Temperatures above freezing over the last several days is starting the snow melt. High temperatures over the next several days will range from the low 50s to the upper 60s in forested areas. This is expected to further ripen the snow pack and, with anticipated melting, will cause increased flows of water into the rivers resulting in rapid rises. There will be variations as to degree of snow melt depending on how high temperatures will get over the next several days. At this time, precipitation will be limited. However, if rainfall occurs later toward the weekend, it will have an impact on forecast rises. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Red River of the North at Fargo. * WHEN...From Friday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, MAJOR FLOOD. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Friday morning and continue rising to 30.1 feet Tuesday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
